Extract from BR18 §445: The total area of the fire compartment is calculated as follows:
- by adding the gross areas of all floors, including inserted floors, basements and usable attics as well as balcony openings, conservatories, connecting corridors and similar.
- Rooms that pass through several floors are only included in the floor in which the floor is located.
- However, both external and internal stairs, stairwells, balconies, installation shafts and elevator shafts are counted for each floor.
The floor area is not included:
- Open balconies (completely open above the railing on at least 2 sides)
- Open roof terraces.
- Bed lofts with an area of up to 4.5 m².
- Projection of external stairs and balconies on the ground.
- External fire escape stairs (escape stairs).
- External insulation of a maximum of 25 cm. 
The floor area is measured in a plane determined by the top of the finished floor to the outside of the limiting external walls with the following deviations:
1) In usable attics, the area in a horizontal plane 1.50 m above the finished floor is included within the intersection of the plane with the outside of the roof covering.
2) For open floors, gates, airlocks and the like, the area is counted to the line indicated by the outer walls of the building.
3) For common walls between rooms that are to be included in each floor area, measure to the middle of the wall; however, for common walls located above the boundary of the property line, measure to the boundary property line.

   Stk. 2. Rum, der går gennem flere etager, medregnes kun til den etage, i hvilken gulvet er beliggende. Både udvendige og indvendige trapper, trapperum, altangange, installationsskakte og elevatorskakte medregnes dog for hver etage.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Fire extinguishing equipment designed as a fixed installation and connected to the building's normal water supply. Used for first response by people in the building. Can be made with rigid or flat hose.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Brandslukningsmateriel udført som fast installation og tilsluttet bygningens normale vandforsyning. Bruges til en førsteindsats af personer i bygningen. Kan være udført med formfast eller flad slange.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Exit doors spaced sufficiently far apart to ensure that at least one of the exit doors is accessible in case of fire in the fire compartment or sub fire compartment
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Udgangsdøre, der er placeret med tilstrækkelig indbyrdes afstand der sikrer, at mindst en af udgangsdørene er tilgængelig i tilfælde af brand i den brandmæssige enhed.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Staircase that connects two or more levels of a building, possibly in open connection with the floors. Used, for example, in multi-storey single-family houses or  in mezzanine levels and in the atriums
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Trappe, der forbinder to eller flere niveauer i en bygning, eventuelt i åben forbindelse med etagerne. Benyttes f.eks. i enfamiliehuse i flere etager eller ved indskudte etager og i atrium

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Delimited part of a building consisting of one or more rooms/spaces, e.g. in hotels and nursing homes, where at least one of the rooms is furnished with sleeping accommodation. TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Afgrænset del af bygning bestående af et eller flere værelser/rum, f.eks. på hoteller og plejehjem, hvor mindst et af rummene er indrettet med sovepladser. Bygning, eller afgrænset del af bygning, henført til anvendelseskategori 4, hvor der bor én familie eller relaterede personer, f.eks. bofællesskab, generationsfællesskab og lignende.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Person who has knowledge of the escape routes of the building or functional fireunit. Either by virtue of the person being familiar with the building (Functional fireunit) or because the building (Functional fireunit) is so simple and clear that the escape routes can be immediately identified.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Person, der har kendskab til bygningens eller bygningsafsnittets flugtveje. Enten i kraft af at personen er bekendt med bygningen (bygningsafsnittet), eller at bygningen (bygningsafsnittet) er så simpel og overskuelig, at flugtvejene umiddelbart kan identificeres.
TM - Equivalent Term: Authorised person, Recognised person, Substitute person, Person of interest
TM - Name (English): People with knowledge of escape routes

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Area in a building to which people can evacuate and where they can stay safe from the fire. From the safe place, evacuation can be continued to the ground in the open.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Område i en bygning, som personer kan evakuere til, og hvor de kan opholde sig i sikkerhed i forhold til branden. Fra det sikre sted kan der ske evakuering videre til terræn i det fri.
TR - ISO definition:
safe refuge

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Escape route that people will intuitively head towards during evacuation, typically the normal access route to a building or room.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Flugtvej, som personer intuitivt vil søge imod ved evakuering, typisk den normale adgangsvej til en bygning eller et rum.
TM - Equivalent Term: Primary escape route, Primary means of escape, Main escape route

TC - Explicit Definition (English): A screen that is suspended outside the outer wall cladding and has a cavity behind it. A rainscreen can be open or closed. From a fire protection point of view, a rainscreen is not a cladding and is not required to be fire protective. Therefore, requirements are only set for a rainscreen's reaction to fire and protection against fire spread via cavities behind the rainscreen, but not for its fire protection ability.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Skærm, som ophænges uden på ydervægsbeklædningen, og som har et bagvedliggende hulrum. En regnskærm kan være åben eller lukket. Brandteknisk set er en regnskærm ikke en beklædning, og den skal ikke være brandbeskyttende. Derfor stilles kun krav til en regnskærms reaktion på brand og sikring mod brandspredning via hulrum bag regnskærmen, men ikke til dens brandbeskyttende evne.
TM - Equivalent Term: Rain shield, Rain shade, Rain shelter

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Height measured from the fire rescue area on the ground to the lower edge of the rescue opening or upper edge of the railing or handrail.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Højde målt fra brandredningsareal på terræn til underkant af redningsåbning eller overkant af rækværk eller gelænder.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): An opening to the outside of a occupied room, such as a window, hatch and balcony door, which is used for emergency rescue or self-help rescue in situations where the occupants of the room are prevented from using the escape routes.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Åbning til det fri i et opholdsrum, f.eks. vindue, lem og altandør, som benyttes i forbindelse med redningsberedskabets redningsindsats eller redning ved egen hjælp i situationer, hvor personerne i rummet er afskåret fra at benytte flugtvejene.

TC - Explicit Definition (English):
The total amount of energy in MJ/m² floor area released by the complete combustion of all combustible material. There are three types of fire load: Variable fire load, permanent fire load and total fire load. The variable fire load consists of fixtures and fittings and is generally used in the building regulations and its guidelines
  when determining the fire load. It is divided into the following groups:
    - Ultra low fire load: Maximum 50 MJ/m²
    - Very low fire load: From 50 MJ/m² and maximum 250 MJ/m²
    - Low fire load: From 250 MJ/m² and maximum 800 MJ/m²
    - High fire load: From 800 MJ/m² and maximum 1,600 MJ/m²
    - Very high fire load: Greater than 1,600 MJ/m²
The permanent fire load consists of the building's combustible structures, surfaces and solid materials. The total fire load is the sum of the variable and permanent fire loads and is used to calculate the fire resistance of structures.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag:
Den samlede energimængde i MJ/m² gulvareal, der frigøres ved fuldstændig forbrænding af alt brændbart materiale. Der skelnes mellem tre typer af brandbelastning: Variabel
  brandbelastning, permanent brandbelastning og samlet brandbelastning. Den variable brandbelastning består af inventar og oplag og benyttes generelt i bygningsreglementet og dets vejledninger ved fastlæggelse af brandbelastningen. Den opdeles i følgende grupper:
    - Ultra lav brandbelastning: Højst 50 MJ/m²
    - Meget lav brandbelastning: Fra 50 MJ/m² og højst 250 MJ/m²
    - Lav brandbelastning: Fra 250 MJ/m² og højst 800 MJ/m²
    - Stor brandbelastning: Fra 800 MJ/m² og højst 1.600 MJ/m²
    - Meget stor brandbelastning: Større end 1.600 MJ/m²
Den permanente brandbelastning består af bygningens brændbare konstruktioner, overflader og faste materialer. Den samlede brandbelastning er summen af den variable og den permanente brandbelastning og benyttes ved beregning af konstruktioners brandmodstandsevne.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Building element, e.g. wall, floor construction or door, which is used to create a fire compartment.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Bygningsdel, f.eks. væg, etageadskillelse eller dør, som indgår ved etablering af en brandcelle.
TM - Equivalent Term: Fire cell separation, Fire compartment separation

TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Rum til samling af flere personer, f.eks. teatersal, biografsal, restaurationslokale, selskabslokale, konferencerum, kantine, diskotek, natklub, koncertsal, udstillingslokale, messehal, idrætshal, kirkerum og andre lokaler, der anvendes til lignende formål.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Stairs in an escape route used in the event of an evacuation and often also used as a fire brigade entry route. Often located in its own fire compartment with access to the ground outside, possibly via a vestibule, to ensure that the staircase retains its function as an escape and entry route in case of fire. No storage or furniture may be placed in an escape staircase and the space must be free of fire loads
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag:
Trappe i flugtvej, som benyttes i tilfælde af evakuering, og som ofte også benyttes som redningsberedskabets indtrængningsvej. Er ofte placeret i sin egen brandmæssige enhed med udgang
  til terræn i det fri, evt. via et vindfang, for at sikre, at trappen bevarer sin funktion som flugtvej og indtrængningsvej i tilfælde af brand. Der må ikke henstilles oplag eller inventar i en flugtvejstrappe og rummet skal være uden brandbelastning

TC - Explicit Definition (English): The floor area of a room measured to the inside face of the surrounding walls. When calculating the area, no deduction is made for the area of any columns and other building elements in the room
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Areal af et rums gulvoverflade afgrænset af rummets omgivende vægge. Ved beregning af arealet foretages der ikke fradrag for areal af eventuelle søjler og andre bygningsdele i rummet

TC - Explicit Definition (English): A kitchenette is a room without heating surfaces such as an oven, hob or fryer, but where a microwave, kettle, dishwasher, refrigerator and coffee machines or coffee makers may be present. This type of kitchen, where no food is produced, is not considered a room with a particular fire hazard. Similarly, smaller kitchens that include an oven, hob or deep fryer are considered a special fire hazard and are therefore not a Kitchenette
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Te- eller anretterkøkken er et rum uden varmeflader i form af ovn, kogeplade eller friture, men hvor der kan forefindes mikrobølgeovn, elkedel, opvaskemaskine, køleskab og kaffeautomater eller –maskiner. Denne type køkken, hvor der ikke produceres mad, anses ikke som et rum med en særlig brandfare. Tilsvarende mindre køkkener, hvor der indgår ovn, kogeplade eller friture, anses at udgøre en særlig brandfare og er dermed ikke et Te- eller anretterkøkken
TM - Equivalent Term: Tea or appetiser kitchen, Tea or catering kitchen, Tea or side dish kitchen, Sideboard kitchen

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Kitchen in general, means a cooking space in residential units, including communal kitchens in dormitories and the like.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Ved køkken generelt forstås et rum til madlavning i boligenheder, herunder fælleskøkkener på kollegier og lignende.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Production kitchen is a commercial kitchen that is a workplace where food is prepared using hobs, griddles, ovens, grills, fryers and the like.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Produktionskøkken er et storkøkken, der udgør en arbejdsplads, hvor der foregår tilberedning af mad ved brug af kogeplader, stegeplader, ovne, grill, friture og lignende.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): School kitchen is a kitchen used for teaching
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Skolekøkken er et køkken, der bruges til undervisning

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Escape route that is not typically used as an access route during the normal use of the building.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Flugtvej, der typisk ikke benyttes som adgangsvej under bygningens normale brug.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Escape route that is designed as an escape route for several functional fire units simultaneously
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Flugtvej, der er udlagt som flugtvej for flere bygningsafsnit samtidig
TM - Equivalent Term: Common escape route, Joint escape route

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Arrangement in the form of a bed in e.g. homes, hotels, nursing homes, hospitals and in group rooms in nurseries and kindergartens.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Indretning i form af et sengeleje i f.eks. boliger, hoteller, plejehjem, hospitaler samt i grupperum i vuggestuer og børnehaver.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): One or more bedrooms with associated corridors, including escape routes, storage rooms, living rooms and possibly guard rooms, as well as other rooms directly connected to the bedrooms in question.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Et eller flere soverum med tilhørende gange, herunder flugtveje, depotrum, opholdsrum og evt. vagtrum samt andre lokaler med direkte tilknytning til de pågældende soverum.
TM - Equivalent Term: Bedroom section, Sleeping area, Bedroom area

TC - Explicit Definition (English): System consisting of one or more interconnected smoke alarms that detect smoke and alert in the fire unit, e.g. a residence, where the smoke occurs. Smoke alarm systems are connected to the building's power supply and equipped with battery backup.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Anlæg, bestående af en eller flere forbundne røgalarmer, der detekterer røg og varsler i den brandmæssige enhed, f.eks. en bolig, hvor røgen opstår. Røgalarmanlæg er tilsluttet bygningens strømforsyning og forsynet med batteribackup.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): A compact, protective layer in a building structure, typically the outermost layer, that protects underlying materials from the effects of fire for a specific period of time. For example, the outermost part of a wall, the lower part of a soffit or the underside of a roof structure, such as plasterboard cladding.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Et tæt lag i en bygningskonstruktion, typisk det yderste, som beskytter bagvedliggende materialer mod brandpåvirkning i et bestemt tidsrum. Det er eksempelvis den yderste del af en væg, den nederste del af en etageadskillelse eller undersiden af en tagkonstruktion, f.eks. en gipspladebeklædning.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Ceiling located below the ceiling cladding that does not necessarily meet the requirements for the interior ceiling cladding.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Loft placeret under loftsbeklædningen som ikke nødvendigvis opfylder kravene til den indvendige loftsbeklædning.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Outdoor areas on the ground where evacuees are safe from the fire and from which there is unobstructed access to a public area or road. Also used for areas that are large enough for all evacuees to remain at a safe distance from the fire.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Udendørs områder i terræn, hvor evakuerede personer er i sikkerhed for branden, og hvorfra der er uhindret adgang til offentligt areal eller vej. Benyttes også om områder, der er så store, at alle de evakuerede personer kan opholde sig her i sikker afstand fra branden.
TM - Equivalent Term: Outdoor terrain, Terrain in the open air, Terrain in the great outdoors, Off-road terrain

TC - Explicit Definition (English):
Door in escape route system includes:
- Door to open-air terrain
- Door to escape staircase
- Door to escape route corridor in the second fire compartment.
The term is also used as a general term for exits used for evacuation purposes. This can include exit doors, for example when calculating walking distances in a fire compartment, or openings in buildings, including tents, that provide direct access to terrain.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag:
Dør i flugtvejssystem omfattende:
    - Dør til terræn i det fri
    - Dør til flugtvejstrappe
    - Dør til flugtvejsgang i anden brandsektion.
Begrebet anvendes også som en generel betegnelse for udgange, der benyttes i forbindelse med evakuering. Dette kan omfatte udgangsdøre, f.eks. i forbindelse med beregning af gangafstande i en brandmæssig enhed, eller åbninger i bygninger, herunder telte, der giver direkte adgang til terræn i det fri.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Attics, where there is an area that can be used without significant interference with the load-bearing structures. Regardless of whether a usable attic is used or not used, it is considered usable for fire safety purposes.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): A system that controls, suppresses or extinguishes a fire using water as an extinguishing agent. A sprinkler system consists of a water supply, alarm valves and pipework with sprinklers. Sprinklers are fittings that distribute the designed water flow in a predetermined way over a specific area by means of  deflector plates. Sprinklers are usually activated when a liquid-filled glass bulb or fusible link, positioned to block the water flow,  is heated by the fire and breaking at a given temperature. Sprinklers can also be without a glass bulb or fusible link and will be activated by fire alarm system upon detection of smoke or flames.

Sprinklere er armaturer, der ved hjælp af spredeplader fordeler den dimensionerede vandtilstrømning på en forudbestemt måde over et bestemt areal. Sprinklere aktiveres oftest ved, at en væskefyldt glasbulb eller smelteled, som er placeret så den blokerer for vandtilstrømningen, opvarmes af branden og brydes ved en given temperatur. Sprinklere kan også være uden glasbulb eller smelteled, og vil da blive aktiveret ved ABA-detektering af røg eller flammer.

If the building has interconnected spaces between floors (atriums, openings, type 2 staircases, etc.), the areas of all interconnected floors shall be added together when determining the area of the fire compartment. When the maximum area of a fire compartment is exceeded, two or more separate fire compartments shall be formed, separated by fire compartment walls and/or floors. If there are rooms of different purposes or rooms that are dangerous in terms of explosion and fire in a fire compartment, the area of the fire compartment shall be determined according to the purpose of the rooms occupying more than 50% of the total area of the rooms. TC - Explicit Definition (English): Situation in which, from a given point on a horizontal evacuation route, evacuation is only possible in one direction. The dead end is total if it continues along the entire route to an exit to a protected vertical escape route, a safety zone or a refuge area. The distance of the total dead end, expressed in metres, is measured along the axis of the route from that point to the aforementioned exit. The dead end may also be partial if it only continues along a section of the route until it joins another route where there are at least two escape alternatives. The distance of the partial dead end, expressed in metres, is measured along the axis of the dead end section from that point to the axis of the horizontal route where it joins.

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Horizontal or vertical communication within a building which, under the terms of this regulation, provides safe conditions for the evacuation of its occupants. Horizontal evacuation routes may be corridors, antechambers, atriums, galleries or, in large spaces, walkways explicitly marked on the floor for this purpose, which comply with the conditions of this regulation. Vertical evacuation routes may be stairs, ramps, or inclined stairs and escalators, which comply with the conditions of this regulation. Evacuation routes may be protected or unprotected. Protected evacuation routes may be enclosed (interior) or exterior. Unprotected evacuation routes are those that do not fully or partially meet the regulatory conditions for protected routes, although they may be authorised under the conditions set out in this regulation.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Comunicação horizontal ou vertical de um edifício que, nos temos do presente regulamento, apresenta condições de segurança para a evacuação dos seus ocupantes. As vias de evacuação horizontais podem ser corredores, antecâmaras, átrios, galerias ou, em espaços amplos, passadeiras explicitamente marcadas no pavimento para esse efeito, que respeitem as condições do presente regulamento. As vias de evacuação verticais podem ser escadas, rampas, ou escadas e tapetes rolantes inclinados, que respeitem as condições do presente regulamento. As vias de evacuação podem ser protegidas ou não. As vias de evacuação protegidas podem ser enclausuradas (interiores) ou exteriores. As vias de evacuação não protegidas são as que não garantem, total ou parcialmente, as condições regulamentares das vias protegidas, embora possam ser autorizadas nas condições expressas neste regulamento

TC - Explicit Definition (English): Evacuation route equipped with means that protect its users from gases, smoke and fire during the time necessary for evacuation. The cladding of the surrounding construction elements of protected evacuation routes must exhibit a reaction to fire in accordance with the specifications of this regulation. In a protected evacuation route, there must be no unprotected ducts for plumbing, waste or any other purpose, nor any access to ducts, nor pipes for combustible or oxidising gases, combustible liquids or electrical installations. Exceptions to the latter case are those necessary for lighting, fire detection and control of safety systems or devices, or low-voltage communications. Water pipes intended for firefighting are also exempt.
TC - Explicit Definition (Native Languag: Via de evacuação dotada de meios que conferem aos seus utentes proteção contra os gases, o fumo e o fogo, durante o período necessário à evacuação. Os revestimentos dos elementos de construção envolventes das vias de evacuação protegidas devem exibir uma reação ao fogo conforme as especificações do presente regulamento. Numa via de evacuação protegida não podem existir ductos, não protegidos, para canalizações, lixos ou para qualquer outro fim, nem quaisquer acessos a ductos, nem canalizações de gases combustíveis ou comburentes, líquidos combustíveis ou instalações elétricas. Excetuam-se, neste último caso, as que sejam necessárias à sua iluminação, deteção de incêndios e comando de sistemas ou dispositivos de segurança ou, ainda, de comunicações em tensão reduzida. Excetuam-se ainda as canalizações de água destinadas ao combate a incêndios
